info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cabarrus, southeastern Iredell and southwestern Rowan Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Statesville, or near Troutman, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Statesville, Mooresville, Enochville, Troutman, Cleveland, Landis, Coddle Creek Reservoir, China Grove, Lake Norman State Park and Mount Ulla. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
